posts.content:

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
The fact that you want a Halfling Shadowdancer tells me that you want to be DEX-based, but then you chose a weapon that is not finessable, which doesn't make sense. Since you are taking Exotic Weapons anyway, you might as well choose 1 or 2 kukris instead. With that substitution, I think I can make a pretty good build for you, a Rogue / Fighter / Shadowdancer with Epic Dodge and probably also Self Concealment 5.

If you insist on a katana, I might be able to salvage it with a Bard / RDD / SD with Epic Dodge, but probably not SC5..

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I agree with Empyre, if it's not finesseable, then you should build for Strength, and if you build for Strength, average AC is the best you can hope for, not to mention Halflings get a penalty to their starting STR. So basically, what you want is impossible, no wonder you're having trouble building it. Honestly, either drop Halfling for Elf and then you can build for Strength or swap the weapon for Kukris and build for Dexterity and high AC. You can't have both, man. The way it sits, I suggest you take his advice and use Kukris instead.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: 39 AB is very low. That's what happens when you split between STR and DEX. You AC isn't that bad, but if you'd put all the increases to DEX, again it'd be much bigger. I also don't like the spread. I don't see ANY benefits from so many SD levels. Shadow Daze isn't exactly something you wanna focus on. By not going more Rogue, you're forfeiting SA dice, access to feats such as Improved Evasion and Crippling Strike every 3 levels instead of 5 and UMD dumps. By not taking 6 Fighter you're also giving up a feat. If you are going to insist on so many SD levels, then IMO the build will be weak. I'd do this: Rogue 19, SD 5 Fighter 6, using SD just for Defensive Roll (because you need at least 3 to take the class). IIRC HiPS is disabled on Arelith too, right?

posts.author: Mae
posts.content:
Helmets give +3 AC with no other stat bonuses. You can get them with stat, but that's the best AC bonus helmets.
Best Large Shields give +3 AC.
Boots give +1 AC. (As well as usually +1 to 2 abilities.)
Armor usually gives +2 AC.
All the other items are usually Ability/Ability/Skill/Skill.
